headers.subject: Re: give up macintosh

quote.quotepara: Personnaly even if I had (in the past) used Unix, I don't like it. It is so... old, so archaic ; it is only good for geek. Apple failed to give us a true new Mac OS and used what they found : a unix system.

body.para: I know what you mean. It's like Bach. So....old, geeks are definately the only people that could find anything rewarding in it...jackass. Sorry, but these sound like the words of Compaq user.

quote.quotepara: Unix versus Macintosh is the Barbarity versus Civilisation, and I am afraid that barbarity won. The Middle Ages is comming back...

body.para: Alright, setting aside the path of destruction through history tread by your civilization (as it isn't particularly valid, just wanted to poke at you again : ) I think that if you take a moment to consider how many revolutions in the way we use computers have been based in Unix, even our precious macOS, you may reconsider the filthy old unix operating system. No unix: no WWW, no E-mail, no Photoshop. These things all started on Unix. Hard to believe, I know, since it's so...old...barbaric. I think that maybe you're confusing grace of the OS with it's learning curve, two elements that stand distinct.

quote.quotepara: Oh friends, I dream that a new company will reinvent the macintosh... let me tell you the thruth : nobody needs unix.

body.para: You should not be able to use the internet. Someone should stop you. The people whose backs you stand upon should give way.
